tweets.text:
The best movie plot twists are the ones when you don’t even know there’s one coming.

Reminds me that the best way to stay safe IRL with your Crypto is to never tell anyone you even have any. Can’t become a target that way.
And even if you can handle yourself, you still put your loved ones in danger. Seen too many stories of people getting their kids kidnapped for ransom.

I love Crypto, but my 1st love was actually index funds (Boglehead).

I learned the power of simply investing in an index fund and chilling. 

While Crypto already has index funds, they’re all simply a basket of the top Crypto assets.

There’s a business concept I learned years ago. 

Once I implemented it, I started getting more results (and you can apply it to Crypto).

It’s “Work ON your business, not IN your business.”

Imagine that you’re a Chef who just opened up your own restaurant. First, you have to do

Warning: Breakeven Bias 

You're down bad on a coin. It starts going up but you don't want to sell until it breaks even again. 

It's hard for coins to regain its ATH again (in general), esp with new coins launching all the time. Could you sell & bet on a faster horse instead?

If I'm down bad on a count I ask myself:

1. If I had to start from scratch, would I buy this token again?
2. Why would other people buy this token?
3. How realistic is it that this token can gain xxx%?
4. What other opportunities are there in the market?

Damn bros, you can apply this thinking to a stale / bad relationship.

1. If I had to start from scratch, would I date her again?
2. How realistic is it that this relationship improves?
3. What other opportunities are there in the market?

Got lazy and fumbled a ton of airdrops from being into Virtuals / Base.

Would randomly get $500+ here and there. Didn’t want to do the D.D. if they were legit or scams.

They would’ve added up!

You don’t want people seeing your browsing history so you use incognito mode.

In Crypto everything’s public. So every DeFi app you touch and every token you hold gets broadcasted to anyone who cares to look.

Imagine a crypto wallet with incognito mode.

Increasing your luck in Crypto:

- Explore new dApps
- Set aside capital just to learn
- Share your thoughts publicly to attract like-minded people 
- DM people. One connection can change your life. 
- Form mastermind groups
- Leave a “moonbag” when you sell
- Read governance

Be fearful when others are greedy
Be Greedy when others are fearful

What's the move when people stop caring?
Sentiment's trash right now nowhere near as bad as 2018 or 2022 lows. One thing I've learned over the years is the more people think that Crypto's dead, the harder I should go.
